metadata.title: CVE-2020-6851 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenJPEG through 2.3.1 has a heap-based buffer overflow inopj_t1_clbl_decode_processor in openjp2/t1.c because of lack ofopj_j2k_update_image_dimensions validation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6851` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-1ubuntu4').
insighttoolkit4 package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
blender package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
texmaker package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
